result.execSummary:
The defendant Dakota T. Gies was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
With huber and stayed until on or before June 12, 2016 between 6-7 a.m.

Once the jail time has been served and all of the costs in this matter have been paid in full to the Clerk of Court, the Defendant is eligible for expungement per 973.015.  Defendant to follow up with the Clerk of Court regarding the expungement procedure once the costs have been fully paid.

ADDRESS INFO for Dakota T. Gies

Prior: 25540 Jackson Street, Muscoda, WI 53573

Attorney Adrian Wayne Longacre in court with Defendant Dakota T. Gies. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin. Atty Harper informs the Court that the parties have reached an agreement for resolution whereby count 1 will be amended and an additional count added with the filing of an amended information.  DA asks for 16 days in jail and costs with expungement once the costs are paid.  Formal reading waived on the information.  Def pleads no contest.  Court's colloquy on plea.  Finding of guilty.  Counsel address the Court.  Sentence:  Count 1- 16 days jail with huber and 1 day credit, stayed until on or before June 12, 2016; costs.  Count 2 - costs only.  Court imposes one set of DNA surcharges and will permit expungement per 973.015 once costs are paid.

Defendant Dakota T. Gies in court with attorney Adrian Wayne Longacre. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Defense wants trial.  1 day.  Defense stipulates re substance as THC.  Jury trial 5/10.  5/9 at 3:30 - final pretrial.  Final status 4/13 at 11 - yes/no whether trial is going.  Motions, witness lists, and jury instructions due 4/1.  Status conference scheduled for April 14, 2016 at 11:00 am.  Final pre-trial scheduled for May 9, 2016 at 03:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for May 10, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Dakota's dad received the reminder phone text, but has not had contact with Dakota for a very long time.  I took his number off of Dakota's info.  He gave me Dakota's mom's number to put on the case.
